text: I love mushrooms and I love kale and
it's sometimes it's really hard to

why this roasted portobello mushroom
with kale recipe is perfect the
decisions already made you could have
both and it's so delicious so let's get
started I have four portobello mushroom
caps what I've done is sort of trimmed
off the stem end here we're going to add
these to a large baking dish tuck them
in here don't worry if they're a little
overlap eat they're gonna shrink quite a
bit when they roast dress them with a
very light marinade and they're gonna
hang out for about 30 minutes so that
the flavor will go all the way through
them so for the marinade start with a
quarter cup of apple cider vinegar I've
got one tablespoon honey here the honey
is a really nice foil to the tart
acidity of the apple cider vinegar two
cloves of garlic really finely minced
and then seasoned this with little salt
and pepper just to round out the flavors
add about a tablespoon of olive oil I
think I can actually stir this together
here okay
and then just whisk this together until
it is smooth
